References.Title: Why Ukraine matters to Russia so much
References.Description: Ukraine and Kiev specifically is considered by Russians to be the birthplace of their nation. It carries special historic not to mention geopolitical importance, and therefore can't easily be left to fall under the influence of NATO and the United States. This would be kinda like If Pennsylvania Independence Hall, where the United States was formed, was located just outside the US border, and Russia was trying to bring it under it's political influence.

Piece.Title: Odessa Massacre
Piece.Thesis: Following the 2014 armed coup in Kiev, pro Russia local people in Odessa, gather in the central square to protest against what they considered a coup-imposed government. On May 2nd, a large group of Right sector radicals and football hooligans that had travelled all the way from Kiev, attacked the activists. Violent fights followed and the local police failed to control the situation. The pro Russia locals tried to take refuge in a nearby trade union building. They barricaded the entrance to stop the radicals from entering, but the building was set on fire by Molotov bombs. People that jumped from the balconies to escape the burning building were beaten to death or shot on the ground, by the US backed Ukrainian ultra nationalists. 42 people died in the Trade Union Building. Little has been done by west backed Ukrainian governments since then, to hold the perpetrators accountable.

References.Title: Ukrainian rightists burn alive 39 at Odessa union building

According to the official Western media narrative, the USA had nothing to do with that uprising.

Therefore it's harder for westerners to get the context of what appears to be an agressive act of war towards Ukraine.
